description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Xcode-related tools for integration with AI assistants and other MCP clients.

capabilities.name: debug_attach_sim
capabilities.description: Attach LLDB to a running iOS simulator app. Provide bundleId or pid, plus simulator defaults.

capabilities.name: debug_breakpoint_add
capabilities.description: Add a breakpoint by file/line or function name for the active debug session.

capabilities.name: debug_breakpoint_remove
capabilities.description: Remove a breakpoint by id for the active debug session.

capabilities.name: debug_continue
capabilities.description: Resume execution in the active debug session or a specific debugSessionId.

capabilities.name: debug_detach
capabilities.description: Detach the current debugger session or a specific debugSessionId.

capabilities.name: debug_lldb_command
capabilities.description: Run an arbitrary LLDB command within the active debug session.

capabilities.name: debug_stack
capabilities.description: Return a thread backtrace from the active debug session.

capabilities.name: debug_variables
capabilities.description: Return variables for a selected frame in the active debug session.

capabilities.name: build_device
capabilities.description: Builds an app for a connected device.

capabilities.name: clean
capabilities.description: Cleans build products with xcodebuild.

capabilities.name: discover_projs
capabilities.description: Scans a directory (defaults to workspace root) to find Xcode project (.xcodeproj) and workspace (.xcworkspace) files.

capabilities.name: get_app_bundle_id
capabilities.description: Extracts the bundle identifier from an app bundle (.app) for any Apple platform (iOS, iPadOS, watchOS, tvOS, visionOS). IMPORTANT: You MUST provide the appPath parameter. Example: get_app_bundle_id({ appPath: '/path/to/your/app.app' })

capabilities.name: get_device_app_path
capabilities.description: Retrieves the built app path for a connected device.

capabilities.name: install_app_device
capabilities.description: Installs an app on a connected device.

capabilities.name: launch_app_device
capabilities.description: Launches an app on a connected device.

capabilities.name: list_devices
capabilities.description: Lists connected physical Apple devices (iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, Apple TV, Apple Vision Pro) with their UUIDs, names, and connection status. Use this to discover physical devices for testing.

capabilities.name: list_schemes
capabilities.description: Lists schemes for a project or workspace.

capabilities.name: show_build_settings
capabilities.description: Shows xcodebuild build settings.

capabilities.name: start_device_log_cap
capabilities.description: Starts log capture on a connected device.

capabilities.name: stop_app_device
capabilities.description: Stops a running app on a connected device.

capabilities.name: stop_device_log_cap
capabilities.description: Stops an active Apple device log capture session and returns the captured logs.

capabilities.name: test_device
capabilities.description: Runs tests on a physical Apple device.

capabilities.name: doctor
capabilities.description: Provides comprehensive information about the MCP server environment, available dependencies, and configuration status.

capabilities.name: start_sim_log_cap
capabilities.description: Starts capturing logs from a specified simulator. Returns a session ID. By default, captures only structured logs.

capabilities.name: stop_sim_log_cap
capabilities.description: Stops an active simulator log capture session and returns the captured logs.

capabilities.name: build_macos
capabilities.description: Builds a macOS app.

capabilities.name: build_run_macos
capabilities.description: Builds and runs a macOS app.

capabilities.name: get_mac_app_path
capabilities.description: Retrieves the built macOS app bundle path.

capabilities.name: get_mac_bundle_id
capabilities.description: Extracts the bundle identifier from a macOS app bundle (.app). IMPORTANT: You MUST provide the appPath parameter. Example: get_mac_bundle_id({ appPath: '/path/to/your/app.app' }) Note: In some environments, this tool may be prefixed as mcp0_get_macos_bundle_id.

capabilities.name: launch_mac_app
capabilities.description: Launches a macOS application. IMPORTANT: You MUST provide the appPath parameter. Example: launch_mac_app({ appPath: '/path/to/your/app.app' }) Note: In some environments, this tool may be prefixed as mcp0_launch_macos_app.

capabilities.name: stop_mac_app
capabilities.description: Stops a running macOS application. Can stop by app name or process ID.

capabilities.name: test_macos
capabilities.description: Runs tests for a macOS target.

capabilities.name: scaffold_ios_project
capabilities.description: Scaffold a new iOS project from templates. Creates a modern Xcode project with workspace structure, SPM package for features, and proper iOS configuration.

capabilities.name: scaffold_macos_project
capabilities.description: Scaffold a new macOS project from templates. Creates a modern Xcode project with workspace structure, SPM package for features, and proper macOS configuration.

capabilities.name: session-clear-defaults
capabilities.description: Clear selected or all session defaults.

capabilities.name: session-set-defaults
capabilities.description: Set the session defaults needed by many tools. Most tools require one or more session defaults to be set before they can be used. Agents should set all relevant defaults up front in a single call (e.g., project/workspace, scheme, simulator or device ID, useLatestOS) to avoid iterative prompts; only set the keys your workflow needs.

capabilities.name: session-show-defaults
capabilities.description: Show current session defaults.

capabilities.name: boot_sim
capabilities.description: Boots an iOS simulator.

capabilities.name: build_run_sim
capabilities.description: Builds and runs an app on an iOS simulator.

capabilities.name: build_sim
capabilities.description: Builds an app for an iOS simulator.

capabilities.name: describe_ui
capabilities.description: Gets entire view hierarchy with precise frame coordinates (x, y, width, height) for all visible elements. Use this before UI interactions or after layout changes - do NOT guess coordinates from screenshots. Returns JSON tree with frame data for accurate automation. Requires the target process to be running; paused debugger/breakpoints can yield an empty tree.

capabilities.name: get_sim_app_path
capabilities.description: Retrieves the built app path for an iOS simulator.

capabilities.name: install_app_sim
capabilities.description: Installs an app in an iOS simulator.

capabilities.name: launch_app_logs_sim
capabilities.description: Launches an app in an iOS simulator and captures its logs.

capabilities.name: launch_app_sim
capabilities.description: Launches an app in an iOS simulator.

capabilities.name: list_sims
capabilities.description: Lists available iOS simulators with their UUIDs.

capabilities.name: open_sim
capabilities.description: Opens the iOS Simulator app.

capabilities.name: record_sim_video
capabilities.description: Starts or stops video capture for an iOS simulator.

capabilities.name: screenshot
capabilities.description: Captures screenshot for visual verification. For UI coordinates, use describe_ui instead (don't determine coordinates from screenshots).

capabilities.name: stop_app_sim
capabilities.description: Stops an app running in an iOS simulator.

capabilities.name: test_sim
capabilities.description: Runs tests on an iOS simulator.

capabilities.name: erase_sims
capabilities.description: Erases a simulator by UDID.

capabilities.name: reset_sim_location
capabilities.description: Resets the simulator's location to default.

capabilities.name: set_sim_appearance
capabilities.description: Sets the appearance mode (dark/light) of an iOS simulator.

capabilities.name: set_sim_location
capabilities.description: Sets a custom GPS location for the simulator.

capabilities.name: sim_statusbar
capabilities.description: Sets the data network indicator in the iOS simulator status bar. Use "clear" to reset all overrides, or specify a network type (hide, wifi, 3g, 4g, lte, lte-a, lte+, 5g, 5g+, 5g-uwb, 5g-uc).

capabilities.name: swift_package_build
capabilities.description: Builds a Swift Package with swift build

capabilities.name: swift_package_clean
capabilities.description: Cleans Swift Package build artifacts and derived data

capabilities.name: swift_package_list
capabilities.description: Lists currently running Swift Package processes

capabilities.name: swift_package_run
capabilities.description: Runs an executable target from a Swift Package with swift run

capabilities.name: swift_package_stop
capabilities.description: Stops a running Swift Package executable started with swift_package_run

capabilities.name: swift_package_test
capabilities.description: Runs tests for a Swift Package with swift test

capabilities.name: button
capabilities.description: Press hardware button on iOS simulator. Supported buttons: apple-pay, home, lock, side-button, siri

capabilities.name: gesture
capabilities.description: Perform gesture on iOS simulator using preset gestures: scroll-up, scroll-down, scroll-left, scroll-right, swipe-from-left-edge, swipe-from-right-edge, swipe-from-top-edge, swipe-from-bottom-edge

capabilities.name: key_press
capabilities.description: Press a single key by keycode on the simulator. Common keycodes: 40=Return, 42=Backspace, 43=Tab, 44=Space, 58-67=F1-F10.

capabilities.name: key_sequence
capabilities.description: Press key sequence using HID keycodes on iOS simulator with configurable delay

capabilities.name: long_press
capabilities.description: Long press at specific coordinates for given duration (ms). Use describe_ui for precise coordinates (don't guess from screenshots).

capabilities.name: swipe
capabilities.description: Swipe from one point to another. Use describe_ui for precise coordinates (don't guess from screenshots). Supports configurable timing.

capabilities.name: tap
capabilities.description: Tap at specific coordinates or target elements by accessibility id or label. Use describe_ui to get precise element coordinates prior to using x/y parameters (don't guess from screenshots). Supports optional timing delays.

capabilities.name: touch
capabilities.description: Perform touch down/up events at specific coordinates. Use describe_ui for precise coordinates (don't guess from screenshots).

capabilities.name: type_text
capabilities.description: Type text (supports US keyboard characters). Use describe_ui to find text field, tap to focus, then type.
